workflow.name: Detect holiday conflicts & suggest meeting reschedules with Google Calendar and Slack
workflow.description:
**Who‚Äôs it for**

Remote and distributed teams that schedule across time zones and want to avoid meetings landing on public holidays‚ÄîPMs, CS/AM teams, and ops leads who own cross-regional calendars.

**What it does / How it works**

The workflow checks next week‚Äôs Google Calendar events, compares event dates against public holidays for selected country codes, and produces a single Slack digest with any conflicts plus suggested alternative dates. Core steps: Workflow Configuration (Set) ‚Üí Fetch Public Holidays (via a public holiday API such as Calendarific/Nager.Date) ‚Üí Get Next Week Calendar Events (Google Calendar) ‚Üí Detect Holiday Conflicts (compare dates) ‚Üí Generate Reschedule Suggestions (find nearest business day that isn‚Äôt a holiday/weekend) ‚Üí Format Slack Digest ‚Üí Post Slack Digest.

**How to set up**

Open Workflow Configuration (Set) and edit: countryCodes, calendarId, slackChannel, nextWeekStart, nextWeekEnd.

Connect your own Google Calendar and Slack credentials in n8n (no hardcoded keys).

(Optional) Adjust the Trigger to run daily or only on Mondays.

**Requirements**

n8n (Cloud or self-hosted)

Google Calendar read access to the target calendar

Slack app with permission to post to the chosen channel

A public-holiday API (no secrets needed for Nager.Date; Calendarific requires an API key)

**How to customize the workflow**

Time window: Change nextWeekStart/End to scan a different period.

Holiday sources: Add or swap APIs; merge multiple regions.

Suggestion logic: Tweak the look-ahead window or rules (e.g., skip Fridays).

Output: Post per-calendar messages, DM owners, or create tentative reschedule events automatically.

workflow.name: Global Holiday Conflict Detector and Meeting Rescheduler

nodes.name: Merge and Filter Next Week Holidays

parameters.content:
**Purpose:** Triggers the workflow once every weekday morning.
**Key:** Runs at 09:00 server time (adjust in node).
**Tip:** Change to weekly if you only need Monday runs.

**Purpose:** Central place to define variables.
**Fields:** `currentYear`, `nextWeekStart`, `nextWeekEnd`, `countryCodes`, `slackChannel`, `calendarId`.
**Tip:** Edit country list and calendar/channel IDs here only.

nodes.name: Note: Merge and Filter Next Week Holidays

parameters.content:
**Purpose:** Merges API results and filters to next week only.
**Output:** `holidays[]` with `date`, `name`, `countryCode`.

nodes.name: Note: Get Next Week Calendar Events

parameters.content:
**Purpose:** Reads all events in next week‚Äôs window from Google Calendar.
**Config:** Uses `calendarId` and `timeMin/Max` from the Set node.
**Note:** Re-connect your own Google credential in n8n.

**Purpose:** Compares event dates with holiday dates to find conflicts.
**Output:** Single item `{ conflicts[], totalConflicts }` so downstream runs once.

**Purpose:** Guards the branch; continues only when conflicts exist.
**Condition:** Array not empty.

**Purpose:** Suggests next business day that is not a holiday/weekend.
**Logic:** Looks ahead up to 30 days, preserving original start time.

**Purpose:** Creates a readable Slack message.
**Includes:** Event, date/time, affected countries, holiday, suggestion.

**Purpose:** Posts the digest to Slack.
**Config:** Uses `slackChannel` from the Set node.
**Note:** Re-connect your own Slack OAuth in n8n (left unconfigured).

**Purpose:** Iterates through each country code.
**Flow:** Splits the array to call the holiday API per country, then loops back.

**Purpose:** Calls Nager.Date API for public holidays.
**URL:** `https://date.nager.at/api/v3/PublicHolidays/{year}/{country}`.
**Security:** No API key needed. Keep credentials empty.

## What this template does
Detects global public-holiday conflicts in **next week‚Äôs** meetings and posts a Slack digest with suggested reschedule dates.

## Who it‚Äôs for
Remote and distributed teams that want to avoid scheduling meetings on regional holidays.

## How it works
1) Fetch public holidays for selected country codes.  
2) Pull next week‚Äôs events from Google Calendar.  
3) Detect date overlaps and generate a reschedule suggestion (next weekday that isn‚Äôt a holiday).  
4) Post a single Slack summary message.

## How to set up
- Configure **countryCodes**, **calendarId**, and **slackChannel** in the **Workflow Configuration** (Set) node.  
- Connect your own Google Calendar and Slack credentials in n8n (left as unauthenticated by design).

## Requirements
- n8n (self-hosted or Cloud)  
- Slack app with chat:write and channel access  
- Google Calendar with read access

## Customize
- Change the time window by editing `nextWeekStart/End` in **Workflow Configuration**.  
- Adjust the suggestion logic in **Generate Reschedule Suggestions**.

main.node: Merge and Filter Next Week Holidays

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
